Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anne B
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, a short walk to everything. The staff were very helpful, nice and spoke English. A wonderful rooftop, I would think the best in town. The room was small but well functioning and very clean. Next times in Istanbul I am going to stay at Adamar Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie B
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with a perfect location to see the major sights of Istanbul by foot. Short walk to get to all major sights, including hop on/off bus station. The staff at hotel are excellent and will help plan any exursion, or even arrange for airport pickup. The hotel has a rooftop restaurant which for an early evening dinner has excellent views of the blue mosque and bospherous. Rooms are clean, and spacious enough for a couple. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay at Adamar--one of the best values (and views) anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: lazyike
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adamar in 2010 and returned with my son and daughter-in-law for another stay in February 2012. The rooms are not fancy, but they are nice and they are CLEAN! The off-season rates (including tax and breakfast) cannot be beat. You can walk to virtually any site in Istanbul from this location. The staff is great, and we made a fast friend in Bulut, who became our buddy during our stay and even offered to let me use his camera when mine broke. I have no reservations about wholeheartedly endorsing the Adamar after my second stay. Hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ryan W
Reviews.Content: Adamar Hotel was an excellent choice and we will definitely be returning. They picked us up at the airport, had a very helpful reception (even with the oddest of our questions) and the rooftop panoramic view is the perfect way to start the day with the complimentary breakfast and end a day with a drink at sunset. Everyone spoke fluent english. Within a block of Aya Sofia and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel, really good located”
Reviews.Author: Elke A
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice rooms and is very clean. The service is good and employees very helpful. The roof terrace is great with a perfect view over the city to the Golden Horn. The location of the hotel is really perfect. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are just 5 min walking distance. Fish House Sultanahmet is 3 walking minutes away from the hotel and just delicious. We would definately come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exsellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gunay A
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Panoramic restaurant is amazing. Exsellent location (nearly:Haya Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace and Sultanahmet), and the room kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelbugNY7
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay. We had room ending in -01. They are TINY, even by manhattan standards. But modern and clean. Can't beat the location...steps to the Cistern and Hagia Sophia. The prices are great, especially with one free airport transfer. The breakfast was very tasty and the rooftop where they serve it is pleasant. The staff is reserved but polite. I must warn of sleep quality though...very loud here!

Reviews.Title: “Unrivaled view, fanastic location, great value”
Reviews.Author: TravelDr6182
Reviews.Content: The Adamar did not disappoint in any facet. First, the view from the rooftop terrace is unlike any I have seen elsewhere in the world. Due to the height of the building, the terrace offers a completely unobstructed view of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque that is spectacular. If the weather is not cooperative, the restaurant just below the terrace with floor to ceiling windows offers equally impressive views. Equally important is the location of the hotel. We literally walked everywhere. The tram runs very close to the Adamar but we did not board it once as you can walk to all attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cisterns, turkish baths, Grand Bazaar, spice market, multiple shopping & restaurant districts) including the Galata district across the Golden Horn. Half the fun of any trip is walking around and experiencing the local culture and the Adamar is perfectly situated to do just that. The hotel itself is a fantastic operation. The rooms were always very clean, the bathrooms are almost palatial compared to standard European bathrooms. The staff at the front desk, namely Bulut, were always incredibly helpful and never lead us astray in terms of restaurants & shopping. My father's camera broke on the trip and Bulut actually brought in his own personal camera and offered it to us to use for the remainder of the trip. The included breakfast buffet is impressive as well. Can't complain about eating eggs & sausage while looking at Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque! Would wholeheartedly recommend the Adamar to any would be Istanbul traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: zilt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in February on a city-break with the family & friends. The huge plus for the Adamar is the location, as it is staggering distance to the main Sultanahmet sites; Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and a relatively short walk to shops, the Grand & Spice Bazaars, Galati Bridge & other sites, although be warned that these are up & down some steep hills. The tram stop is also close by for trips further afield. The hotel is clean, staff friendly and the rooftop restaurant provides some of the best views around, being able to see over to both the Hagia Sofia & Golden Horn sides of Sultanahmet. We only took breakfast in the hotel, which was an acceptable buffet. We booked a family room which was only just large enough for the 4 of us, with our two teenage children sleeping on temporary beds which were jammed closely together. However for the price we paid this was an acceptable compromise. We booked through ebookers and got the room for around 100 Euro's per night. Some refurbishment was going on in the hotel, but this had no impact on our stay. Overall a good hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “No Doubt a Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: vindzhov
Reviews.Content: The corner building of Adamar is unusually high for this part of Istanbul, which reasonably means greatest views simultaneously from Bosphorus & Marmara. Through a spiral staircase up (it's more enjoyable than the elevator, each floor is in different style and colour) is reachable the restaurant on the top. By reaching it, you need several minutes to look around to understand the great view. It is difficult to say if view is better day time or at the evening, it is always amazing and breath-taking. So far the hotel is new and modern, the rooms are very fresh, clean and well maintained, it is very often fully booked. But even if you have not the luck to book the overnight, do not think twice to book the restaurant. Must be with a top looking companion to be able to fix your eyes on something else then outside. :)))

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: bazik_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in Octomer 2011 with my friends. It was not my first visit to Istanbul, but for sure Adamar was the best hotel I've ever stayed at in Istanbul! The view from terrace at the breakfast is breathtaking! The location is excellent! Walking distance to all sightseeing in Sultanahmet! The hotel is highly recomended!

Reviews.Title: “very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LUPOEMANUELE
Reviews.Content: very good service, room very beautyfull,good information and wanderfull terrace

Reviews.Title: “the Hotel with the best terrace overviewing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JAUrlaub
Reviews.Content: Welcome in this small Hotel with a very personal service Team, the rooms are small but beautyfull with everything yu need, the restaurant at the last floor is nicely done with the star ceiling if the weather is not nice. if the weather is perfect you should choose the terrace for Lunch and Diner 360 degrees overview about Istanbul / Europa and Asia. Enjoy the Kitchen and the lovely service staff.

Reviews.Title: “January vacation”
Reviews.Author: Galina N
Reviews.Content: dates 2.01.12-7.01.12. The hotel was chosen thanks to its great location and a number of good recommendations found in Internet. I booked the room in a hurry and didn't read carefully the description of all rooms, probably I would have tried to book a bigger one, because ours was a bit smaller than we had expected. But it wasn't a big problem really. Breakfast for a 4* hotel was good (yourguts, cottage cheese, cheese, eggs, sausages, ham etc.) and the views from the restaurant (on the top of the building) just splendid! the staff was friendly and all questions at the reception area were resolved quickly and efficiently. The transfers were organised perfectly. WiFi in the room worked OK.

Reviews.Title: “Would rebook”
Reviews.Author: Wherearewetodaydear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid December for 3 nights. The hotel was welcoming, clean , comfortable and convenient for all the Old City sights. Roof top and restauraunt views of the Hagia Sophia, Blue mosque and the Golden Horn, (wrong weather for blistering sunsets).. Breakfast range of juices, cereals, cheeses, dried fruits, olives and turkish pastries. Small hot food selection, omelettes on request. Coffee a bit strong ! Rooms are compact but clean,comfortable and ok for a short stay. Lobby internet access was good. Staff helpful throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: HeatherandRob
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a base to explore the city. The staff were very helpful and even though the room was small it was very clean and had all you needed provided you are not looking for luxury. Spectacular views from the roof garden and resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: daniel b
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in the Adamar in august, service was exceptional! Our room was on the small side but was newly redecorated and spotlessly clean! The service especially from the manager was far better than some so called five star hotels have stayed at. Location is excelent and just a few hundred meters from the blue mosque/ hagia sofia, but still quiet at night as it is not on the main drag! Will be going back next time I am in Istanbul as I have expierianced nothing better for the price! Dan

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back to this hotel next time I'm in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: PensionBacolodPRO
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Adamar was absolutely delightful. I visited Istanbul with a large group of students from DC and I was surprised at how well received and organized the staff was. For the price, Hotel Adamar offers arguably one of the best views of the city at night and one of the most comprehensive Turkish breakfast buffets in the Ancient part of the city. The staff is especially warm and friendly. They all either know English, are learning English, or at least make a solid effort at communicating with both English and non-English speakers. I spent a few nights learning Turkish and in turn teaching English to one of the hotel managers. It definitely came in handy at the grand Bazaar. They were also kind enough to send my postcards for me and often gave me free tea. Next time I'm in the city, my girlfriend will be with me watching the breathtaking sunset on the rooftop of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Sophia1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at adamar and we loved the service, the location, the people, and the room. people in the hotel are so helpful, generous in giving information. the location of the hotel was excellent close to Aya Sophia and the tram, so it was so convient. the prices are very good. and it is very clean. for sure we will go back to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: It is besides the Basilica cistern, only 50 m from (Santa) Hagia Sophia and the tram stop, and 100 m from the Blue Mosque. You can walk from the hotel to most touristic attractions in the old Istanbul. Its panorama terrace offers great views all over the Golden Horn and its surroundings. From this point of view, much better than Hotel Crowne just beside. The hotel has been renovated recently. Crowne aside, the most modern hotel in the area. Free wi-fi, but you have to reconnect whenever you return to your room. The breakfast buffet offers more than enough to keep you active over the day. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small, and the walls are paper thin, this meaning you will hear your neighbors. Staff are just average, not extremely helpful (maybe because of their limited English skills). They do not offer shuttle or "private" transport to the airport, only the hotel car, at prices higher than other alternatives. Beware if you book a taxi through the reception, as the taxi driver may misbehave and try to overcharge you (as happened to us on the way to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for it's price”
Reviews.Author: Happy_TravelBrit
Reviews.Content: Hotel in fantastic position, near all the places to visit. Rooftop terrace is a must, we spent hours up there just takimg in the atmosphere and the view. Food is very good as well. Hotel staff very helpful. Rooms lovely, clean and spacious (we had 3 people in a room and it was ample). Plenty of restaurants to walk to nearby - and felt very safe. One of the best hotels I have stayed in for the money!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ehoeter
Reviews.Content: had a super time hotel was great room was wonderful and staffwere super! right in the middle of everything . Easy to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerky
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul on our own before joining a tour. We had picked the Adamar because of the good communication with the manager, great location and price. Transportation was provided from the airport with a three night stay and it was good and on time. One of the rooms I booked was small but much like large cities over the world. I would highly recommend the hotel. I used recommendations from Tripadvisor and was certainly not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Sultanahmet with fab views”
Reviews.Author: betty485
Reviews.Content: The location was walking distance to most of the major sights in Sultanahmed. It is also close to a tram stop, restaurants and shops. The rooms were small but comfortable. Transportation from the airport was included when you reserved for 3 nights. Views from the rooftop restaurant were thrilling. We were allowed to leave our luggage in the hotel's locked luggage room, when we went to Cappodochia for one night. That was very helpful. The staff was quite accomodating. The buffet breakfast was adequate but not oustanding. The only negative was the one elevator which was often busy and sometimes not in service, for brief periods.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jeelia
Reviews.Content: All the sights are in walking distance from this hotel. It is clean, modern and the staff were very polite and friendly. On booking in there had been an administrative error and we spent the first night in the hotels annexe which although the rooms were small had been recently upgraded. The manager was very apologetic and gave us a discount on our meal and free transfer back to the airport. There was some noise at night but you are staying in a city and it was not intrusive. We were two ladies travelling and we felt very safe in the city and were not hasselled in any way. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money and Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: Pat477
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of many key sights and a range of bars and restaurants. Rooftop restaurant had amazing views, a romantic atmosphere, good food and the staff were friendly. We were upgraded to a corner room which was faultless. Reception staff were very helpful and the whole experience was excellent value for money in what is now becoming an expensive city to visit. The only cons were the slow lift (but the stairs help work up an appetite for the restaurant at the top) and the breakfasts where the choice was limited, the juice should have been fresh and, if you were not there early, there was little left to choose from! However, for the price, it was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pj_n7
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Yes there is some noise from outside a times - mainly traffic and not all the time - no noise from revellers at night though. More noise from adjacent shower/WC and females being a little vocal! The size of the one lift can be a problem especially if you have lots of suitcases and you are trying to make a rapid departure - the stairs are not too be used for carrying bags as they are spiral....Didn't eat here but menu seemed to be reasonably priced. Agree with last review about there being no water on one morning - but to be honest it was only off for about 2 hrs. Positives: Great view from the terrace - breakfast reasonable - safe in the room FREE - wi-fi FREE. Mehmet has good local knowledge and I never felt being pushed into taking any of the tours he recommended - indeed when we said we wanted to do everything under our own steam he mereley showed us where the things were. Small blonde girl in the restaurant very friendly and helpful at breakfast as were ALL the staff. Rooms cleaned very well. Location is the best for using any kind of public transport and for walking to the nearby attractions. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable days”
Reviews.Author: NÃºria C
Reviews.Content: The treatment of people working in the hotel (reception, cleaning, bartenders, etc. ..) = excellent. Hotel Location = excellent The room= excellent The unforgettable view is priceless breakfast with those views. I'm from Barcelona and I always thought my town was very pretty. When I returned from Istanbul did not seem like much. I'll be back soon and I will not tarry. Thanks to everyone who looked after us at the Hotel. From 11 to August 17.2011

Reviews.Title: “liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giorgi_Tsivilashvili
Reviews.Content: first of all staff was friendly. secondly this hotel has a great location. it is in the center of an old Istanbul. It is the highest hotel in that area and almost the whole city is visible from the veranda. and all i can say about the restaurant is that they have an excellent brownie with ice cream

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MihaiAl
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, clean, very nice mornings and evenings on the terrace. A quiet hotel a few minutes away from all the main attractions. The staff is very friendly, maybe a little too much...:) We would definitely stay at Adamar again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jvanmarx
Reviews.Content: Wow, we stayed 4 nights in this lovely and cute Hotel. The rooms are not very big but it is enough as you just will be in the room to sleep. No need for more space. The lacation is, as we say in German: "Hammer!". You will be in the heart of the old City, near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Hammam, the Basilica. The Tram is near and will bring you to all places in Istanbul. We did most of the trips by Taksi. Not very expensive and very comfortable. The Hotel as 5 Floors, a Restaurant for the breakfast in the 6th and an amazing roof-restaurant offering you the best view of Istanbul. The room was clean and the staff very helpfull and nice. Whenever i am in Istanbul i will stay at the Adamar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB VIEW FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL!”
Reviews.Author: amyashley
Reviews.Content: Beer on the terrace while listening to prayer call... superb! Lovely staff and rooms good! Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Eat at the rooftop restaurant. Best view in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: RoxyNYC
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here, but we ate at the rooftop restaurant. It was our last dinner in Istanbul and we were celebrating my father's birthday, so may husband and I went searching for the perfect rooftop restaurant for this meal. We personally checked a handful of the tallest rooftops in the Old City, and this was by far the best. We were searching during the day. However, when we showed up for dinner that night, the view was even more astounding. The Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia are blocks away and marvelously lit up at night. You also get a great view of the Bosphorous and the first twinkling Bosphorous bridge out in the distance. The mezzes were pretty good, but not the best I've had in Istanbul, but our main courses were all fantastic. But, the food almost doesn't even matter given the ridiculous views you get while sitting on this rooftop at night.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and more”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: We asked our travel agent to help us find a nice, small hotel (4 stars or better) on a street with shops and restaurants in a walkable negihborhood close to attractions. The Adamar fit the bill perfectly with the added bonus of a rooftop restaurant offering what have to be the best views in all of Istanbul. Hotel staff members were courteous, personable and engaging -- just the right touch after days spent dodging rug vendors and jostling with tourists and locals in the dynamic and crowded streets and markets of old and new Istanbul. The room was comfortable, modern and had its own milliondollar view of the harbor and the Galata Tower. Even the complimentary map was indispensable -- the best resource we found for navigating streets and transit systems. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The best rooftop view in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: travelman033
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel conveniently situated within walking distance of most attractions. Friendly, helpful staff. One of the best rooftop views in Istanbul from the roof top restaurant.This was our second visit and the standard was the same. Ate breakfast and dinner there watching the sun set over the city. Magic

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to spend with family”
Reviews.Author: RinkuShetty
Reviews.Content: great hotel with excellent panoramic view restaurant by the day and the night---good room service, clean and neat----great staff and very helpful customer service. Rooms are nice and cozy, not very spacious but value for money and the best of all it is close to the major attractions of Sultanahmet and the local transit system. Overall a very pleasant and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: desertwanderer88
Reviews.Content: Great, central hotel within walking distance to all the sights Istanbul has to offer. Stunning view from the rooftop bar. Nice breakfast with good variety. There is an ongoing problem with the a/c in Room 105 (which we were given). The a/c needs repairs and a loud generator noise kicked in when it was the kids' bedtime. After several complaints that night and the following morning, the manager finally agreed for us to change rooms. They were not going to initially so we did have to persevere! We were moved to the family room on the 4th floor and that was absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Adamar Hotel - Outstanding location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: David20110707
Reviews.Content: With just a couple of minutes to stroll to the Hagia Sophia, the hotel location would be hard to better. Taking the small but silent lift to the Hotelâ€™s rooftop restaurant the uninterrupted panorama of Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Galata Tower across the Golden Horn and numerous ships plying the Bosporus is truly memorable by day and magical by night. Rooms are quite small but clean with a comfortable bed, well furnished shower room, flat screen satellite TV, mini bar and room safe. Breakfast choice is good and dinner in the restaurant well prepared, as were all the meals we ate elsewhere. We used the Havas bus from the airport to Taksim Square and then trams and buses to get around, all worked fine but the trams can get very crowded. We were impressed by the high proportion of Turkish families visiting the main sites and the effort they all made to keep the streets litter free. However, suggest you avoid the overpriced dinner cruise and just take the bus tour to orient the city and then a daytime boat trip into the Golden Horn and onto the Bosporus.

Reviews.Title: “Good loation for tourist, kind and helpful receptionist...”
Reviews.Author: motorkevin
Reviews.Content: It's our first time to be Istanbul. We stay here for two nights. First we choose this hotel just for its location which is close to those places of interests. But after we settle down, we begin to love this hotel for its good view on the top and helpful receptionists. Here we want to express our thanks ro them. This is a hotel that can be trusted.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: saleemydawood
Reviews.Content: Thank you to TA for exposing me to this fantastic hotel. Service impeccable - better than some 5 star establishments that I have stayed in around the world. Location can't be matched - in old city within walking distance of all sights. Special mention to MEHMET in reception - concierge par excellence - nothing was too much of a problem - very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Have stayed at 5 star establishments in new city but will definitely be back to this hotel. Finally, restaurant on roof has the most amazing views. Includes a good complimentary breakfast - really good value for money. Dr. S. Dawood Cape Town

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a visit to old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bathgooner
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed here for the second time in two years. The location is perfect for a visit to Istanbul, a short walk to Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. The views from the restaurant and the roof terrace justify the visit alone. You can gaze on the great mosques, look up the Bosporus or glance across to the Galata tour as you breakfast or dine. Thoroughly recommended. If you book diect you will be met at the airport and if you need to travel further the helpful staff will organise a trusted cab. If you can tear yourself away from the view, there are many good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay in this hotel for sure for our next visit”
Reviews.Author: JJ04_2007
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this lovely hotel. The location is perfect. Within walking distance to all the attractions in the old town. The view in the terrace has to be one of the best in town. The staff at the front desk are always there to help you. We will defintely choose this hotel when we return to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “we will definately come back”
Reviews.Author: blacktower1
Reviews.Content: hi guys thanks for good service it has a great view restaurant , the best view of istanbul i ever seen , nice ppl nice place

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rachwill02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the Sultanahmet area 2 minutes walking distance from the Blue Mosque and Haggia Sophia. The location really made our sightseeing convienient. Mehmet and the rest of the staff at Adamar were very friendly and helpful. We were picked up from the airport and greeted with juice upon arrival. Then after settling in we came down to the lobby and were treated to Turkish tea while being shown the highlights of things to see and do in Istanbul. The rooms were nice with adequate bathrooms. We would stay here again on our next trip to the very cool city of Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with beautiful view from restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: sengalei
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few hundred meters from the cicsternes, the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. On the roof you havea spectacular view over the sights of Istanbul. The personal was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and clean. Although the hotel is so near too the city it lies in a quiet street, so you can sleep without being disturbed. Wlan is provided and everywhere in the hotel receivable.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was the highlight of the stay in Istanbul, outstanding service, breathtaking views and excellent food.”
Reviews.Author: serdarkurtoglu
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Adamar Hotel we were greeted with smiles and were shown the rooms without delay. The rooms are very modern, with views from our windows, including the shower. The food on the rooftop restuarant was fantastic with views that stretch from the Harbour to the great monuments surrounding this great city. Overall, the Hotel was very accommodating to all our needs, I would like to thank the Concierge, I forget his name,He was very helpful from carrying our luggage to organising our Airport Transfers. Thanks for the great memories, Will be back for a longer stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Bronsworld
Reviews.Content: Great location with so many of the major tourist attractions only a few minutes walk. The restaurant has amazing 360 degree views of Istanbul and has an open roof top dinning and enclosed dinning section. Mehmet and the staff made me feel very welcome and were able to assist with any enquiries l had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Doc_UK
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Blue mosque and other major tourist sights. Has a couple of tram stops just near by and is an easy walk to shopping and dining spots. A bit of a trip to the new areas up on the hill but easily done with the trams. Rooms small but comfortable and a pleasant breakfast up in the top floor restaurant looking out over Istanbul and the waterways below. Helpful front staff who weren't trying to sell you tours or trips - which was rather nice. Good value for money especially given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBD007
Reviews.Content: Mehmet will take care of you. Very helpful. Location couldn't be better. Same block as the Bascilica Cistern, Next block is the Aiya Sophia. Bazaar 4 blocks away. 7 restaurants on the block excluding the one at the top of the hotel which has the very best views imaginable. If you stand in the Sophia entry and look up Yetereban what is most prominent is the restaurant at the Adamar. Excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: andras79
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, in the hearth of the Sultanahmet district. All the important monuments /sights are in walking distance. The staff is friendly, helpful. The room was ok, more than enough for us (2 adults+baby) The breakfast is not the best. I think in a 4 star hotel it should be a bit bigger selection and better quality. The restaurant on the 6th floor has a beautiful view. It was a very nice stay, Istanbul is beautiful. There is a wi if connection, but it was not a high speed connection,sometimes it was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, absolutely loved the room. Thorougly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: wombat60
Reviews.Content: I chose this because of Trip Advisor. My comments to the hotel were that it lived up to all the reviews. The location is perfect, two/three minutes to Sultanahmet Square. My Deluxe Room had panorama view of the Bosphorus, Topkapi Palace, and Aya Sofia - worth paying for. The room was small (typical inner city hotel), but had 7 big windows so was very light and felt spacious, although there were no chairs for lounging, but who wants to lounge in Istabul. The big bathroom window looked over the Bosphorus - pity it fogged up! Very friendly, helpful staff. Mehmet told me to write nice things! But I didn't need to be told. My room was on the fifth floor, restaurant is on the 6th, if you were supersensitive to noise it might worry you a little bit, but it was quiet by 11pm, and the noise was gentle anyway. Little street noise, maybe double glazing - it seemed very quiet for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! The hotel was recommended to us & we are so grateful for that.”
Reviews.Author: JKSevenoaks
Reviews.Content: Great neighbourhood for the hotel, so easy to access the trams or walk from here with loads of attractions to visit on the doorstep. Our twin bedded room was on the 5th floor, so no noise issues and it had an amazing view. The size was larger than I had expected from the other reviews & more than adequate for our needs. The Turkish people were really friendly & helpful all over Istanbul, and Mehmet in reception did a great job in helping sort out our plans.

Reviews.Title: “To this hotel I would come back”
Reviews.Author: Henrie58
Reviews.Content: A very nice location in the heart of Istanbul. Modern rooms, very friendly staff, especially Memo who solved every problem. The restaurant and the roof terrace offer a fantastic view over the city. Our room was a little bit small, but we had no need to stay in it apart from sleeping. Because of the reason that the hotel is located near a lot of objects of interest, there was very much traffic, which is normal in such a big metropole.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: finkmichael
Reviews.Content: Already upon arrival, we were very positively impressed with the competence and friendlyness of Mehmet, the receptionist on night duty. Due to a very late arrival we then enjoyed the marvellous view of the illuminated Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia and the TopKapi palace, which are literally in walking distance from the roof top restaurant level. The location is excellent, allowing to reach all relevant historical and cultural sites in less than 20 minutes walking. Even though somewhat loud in the morning, the overall impression of the hotel and it's staff were excellent and definitely good price value. Summary : Very clean and friendly hotel in excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location offering good value”
Reviews.Author: magmidge
Reviews.Content: What a gem this hotel is and a great location with Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia right on the doorstep. Hotel staff, especially Mehmet, were very helpful and nothing too much trouble. Modern rooms, excellent breakfast and the roof top terrace offered fantastic views - would definately book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and customer service”
Reviews.Author: DoreenC
Reviews.Content: Difficult to find any fault with the Adamar, staff (particularly Mehmet) who couldn't do enough to make our stay enjoyable, unbeatable views from the rooftop terrace, very comfortable and clean room, good breakfast and a location that couldn't be more central for both sightseeing and eating. Only downside was the traffic noise from the busy street outside, which was only partially reduced by the double glazing - but we were on the first floor, so higher floors may be quieter. Whatever, I just want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “The location with a panoramic view and Mehmet & staff were superb.”
Reviews.Author: foxHamiltonnewyork
Reviews.Content: The Adamar is the perfect place to stay in Istanbul. Centrally located in the historic district, one can see St. Sofia's and the sea from the room 402 window. The hotel has a 6th floor restaurant with a panoramic view of the city, as well as an open air level. A Turkish bath is a MUST only 2 blocks away at the most famous bath house in the world. The Blue Mosque and Hippodrome is in walking distance... We have already recommended this hotel to an acquaintance who was visiting his son in Istanbul, and he booked a room there immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique hotel, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KymH
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, myself and two friends) stayed at the Adamar hotel for four nights over the May bank holiday weekend. We both had double rooms and whilst these were fairly compact in size, they were tastefully decorated and themed, and had all the amenities required. > > If you're a light sleeper try to avoid rooms on Yerebatan Street as there is a bit of traffic noise or request a high floor, we were on the 2nd floor and it woke me most mornings. I notice someone mentioned about the early morning prayer call, and although I'm a light sleeper I didn't hear it. Unfortunately the hotel experienced a problem with their hot water system whilst we were there, but this was quickly rectified. There is free wifi access for anyone taking a laptop or free internet access using the hotel computer in the lobby. > > The hotel is ideally located close to many of the tourist sights, 5 minutes walk to the Basilica Cistern, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Approx 15 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar and the same to the Spice Bazaar. > > Fantastic panoramic views from the roof top terrace and the Restaurant, overlooking, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Bosphorus and Marmara Sea. > > All the staff at the Adamar hotel and restaurant are very pleasant, helpful and welcoming. In particular, Mehmet was very informative and helpful during our stay, nothing was too much trouble for him. The hotel organised our transfer from the airport to the hotel for us at a cost of â‚¬30 pick up and â‚¬25 return, although I notice If you book the hotel online through their website for more than 3 nights you receive a free transfer from the airport so worth bearing in mind. > > There are lots of other nice restaurants in the area. The biggest problem is that everyone wants your business, so there's quite a lot of hassle from restaurants to try to persuade you to choose their restaurant to dine in. We found this everywhere we visited in Istanbul, and even more so if you try to walk along the lower level of the Galata bridge. >See my other reviews or reviews on restaurants in istanbul for our favourite restaurant. > > We took a boat trip on the Bosphorus, which was followed by a trip to Pierre Loti Hill a panoramic view point and then taken back down by cable car book. This was an enjoyable trip. > > We also had a day on the City Sightseeing bus, which was informative, but only has 6 hop on hop off points and you have to tell the driver in advance which stops you want to get off otherwise they don't stop as we found out as we missed the HO-HO point at Golden Horn!! HO-HO points we took were: Taksim Square, followed by a walk down to Dolmabahce Palace where we hopped back on the bus. We also hopped off at Edirnekapi - from here we headed in beyond the city walls to Kariye where we had a lovely lunch stop. Also hopped off at the fish market which was also worth a visit. Note the buses don't run on Sundays and they only run every 45 minutes so get your tickets the day before as there is usually a long queue. > > All in all a very enjoyable weekend, would definitely go back to Istanbul and to the Adamar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central, rooms clean and staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: harryruth
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this Hotel for a long weekend Friday to Tuesday and could find no fault in the Hotel and Staff, we were recommended this Hotel by someone else who had stayed how pleased we are that we listened to then as you can't get a better recommendation than this.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: kwillmer
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Adamar hotel. Perfect location, so close to all the main attractions, nice rooms, great staff, rooftop restaurant...totally recommended. A special thanks to Mehmet in the reception for helping us with the ice. ;-) Katy from New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; friendly, comfortable: what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: RandC58
Reviews.Content: Well, The Adamar is not only a comfortable, clean hotel with friendly and very helpful staff in a perfect location which doesn't cost a fortune to stay in but... if you do want more then I suggest you go to the 6th floor and, passing through the restaurant with half closed eyes so you don't spoil the surprise, climb the short staircase to its rooftop bar/restaurant area and prepare yourself for one of the great views. The soaring dome of Haghia Sophia's a stone's throw , the stunningly elegant minarets of the Blue Mosque a little to your right, with the Sea of Marmara as a backdrop, then turn through 180 degrees and there's the start of The Golden Horn, with the cruise ships lining the quayside at Beyoglu by the Galata bridge and tiers of modern Istanbul disappearing into the distance... And to cap it all, the breakfast buffet is very nice indeed with a wide selection of sweets and savouries. We took our coffee on to the roof and watched the boats ply their trade up and down the Bosphorous. If you're lucky enough to be going to Istanbul soon [and everybody should at some time] then you need look no further for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautyful, very clean, best situated to the highlights, view about town”
Reviews.Author: adamaristanbul
Reviews.Content: Adamar Hotel is situated near all highlights of Istanbul, very clean rooms and good beds, best service, restaurant is okay, the view from the restaurant and the roof terrace about the town, Marmara and Bosporus is wonderful. The price for this nice hotel is okay. If we would go to Istanbul again we would take Adamar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations to the Adamar team"”
Reviews.Author: citytripper2011_05
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience last week with our city-trip to Istanbul. With the exploration of the old city in mind, we looked for a nice hotel with a strategically good position. So we found the Adamar hotel in de centre of the Topkapi, Sultanahmet and Bazarquarters. Adamar hotel has many strong points: a nice accommodation and clean and comfortable rooms, amazing panoramic restaurant with a view over the whole town and terrace on the roof. Staff is very client oriented which creates an enjoyable atmosphere. We were the lucky clients who got a splendid room on the fifth floor.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the perfect short break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Willie_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: The Adamar Hotel is in the perfect location in the cultural heart of Istanbul. Surrounded by the most amazing sights a city centre can hold. The Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar are all within a few minutes walk. The staff were the most friendly and helpful Iâ€™ve met on my travels for some time. I was initially greeted by Mehmet who after I had checked in stayed after his shift to help organise my trips for the week. The rooms are neat and perfectly adequate for a short stay. The food in the hotel restaurant was very good with a good selection and again the staff were excellent. I would recommend this to everyone if your going to Istanbul for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gusgator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adamar for 3 nights recently. We found it to be absolutely terrific, with small but spotlessly clean and comfortable rooms, fantastic location (100 meters to Cistern, 200 meters to Aya Sofia) and to top it all off the friendliest and most helpful staff we have come across at any hotel we have stayed at. If this weren't enough there is a roof top restaurant with uninterrupted views to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi, the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus. We had a great dinner here one night, and breakfast every morning - what a start to the day. Heartily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a great location with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: mac-meryl
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed in the Adamar for three nights at the end of April. This hotel is a gem - fairly small but not too small. The rooms over five floors are a good size and very nicely furnishised. with modern fittings and en-suites. Spotlessly clean. The restaurant on the sixth floor has panoramic views over the city and the Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara with the Princes Islands in the distance. The views from the open roof-top terrace are superb - the hotel is literally five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia, and 10 minutes to the Topkapi Palace - so the day and night-time views are fantastic. The restaurant staff are friendly and nothing was too much trouble - they will serve you drinks and light refresments right through the day if you want to relax in the restaurant/ roof top terrace and just take in the views. We finished off our stay with dinner which was very good. A special mention for Mehmet on the front desk, who like many of the staff, spoke excellent English. He was especially helpful and friendly, and has a good sense humour. Thank you Mehmet for all your help in organising taxis and airport transfers. This is an excellent hotel witha first class team of staff. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the view!”
Reviews.Author: MunichMoira
Reviews.Content: After staying in Istanbul for 4 nights we can highly recommend the Adamar hotel. It's situated right in Sultanahmet and in proximity to all the sights but in a side street. On the sixth floor there is a roof deck with wonderful views of Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the sea. You have breakfast full of choices on the fifth floor enjoying the same spectacular roof. The rooms are not too spacious, but very nicely appointed and very clean. We enjoyed staying here and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Layer11
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests The Adamar was a top quality experience. As previous reviewers have said it is ideally located in the heart of old Istanbul and a few minutes walk away from all the main attractions this wonderful city has to offer.The hotel itself provides a superb breakfast in conjunction with service which is of the highest quality. All the staff were extremely helpful and could'nt do enough to make our stay memorable.The Reception team, Mehmet and his colleague were knowledgeable, friendly and outstanding ambassadors of their country and their hotel. The rooms though typical of a boutique hotel were extremely comfortable, clean (very high standard). We highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SKF846
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The location is great. The service is wonderful, especially Mehmet who went out of his way to make sure our stay was great. Make sure you go to the roof top terrace. The view is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: joeandrick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renovated and rooms are excellent, well maintained, and with lots of comfort. Staff could not have been nicer and very helpful. Service in the restaurant was outstanding and the food excellent. The location is one of the best in Istanbul--near the Blue Mosque, Haige Sophia, and some of the best restaurants in town. Our stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded: No room due to overbooking”
Reviews.Author: MindTheTouriTrap
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Adamar hotel they had no room for us although we had two CONFIRMED double rooms booked well ahead!!! Adamar offered us nearby Hotel Noah's Ark instead and free dinner at Adamar as compensation. We inspected the rooms at Noah's Ark which were dark, smelly and old. As Istanbul was almost fully booked it was hard to find new rooms ourselves. We ended up staying at the Hilton Doubletree for double price. Be careful when booking Adamar, make sure you reconfirm before getting stranded. At least they gave us free transfer from the airport to the hotel but the disappointment, lost time and stress remained.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location for all the sites in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Family2
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, very competitively priced and only a few minutes walk from many of the major sites, The Grand Bazaar, the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Yerebatan Sarnici (Sunken Palace), and the Topkapi Palace. A little further afield, but still a comfortable walk,is the Egyptian Spice Market, Galata Bridge and Tower and Suleymaniye Mosque. There are numerous places to eat whichever direction you take. This would give the impression of a very busy and perhaps noisy location but this was not the case as many of the nearby cobbled streets have restricted access to vehicles. The hotel has a very nice informal atmosphere and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. There is free internet access and they dont even charge for the printing. On arrival we were welcomed with fruit juice and assistance with luggage. The restaurant and breakfast room on the 6th floor has the most amazing views over nearly all the sites mentioned above as well as views over the Bosphorus. There is an open terrace on the next floor where you can enjoy open air dining when the weather is warmer. There is so much to see and do in Istanbul. We recommend you purchase an Akbil, (pay as you go device) This allowed us to jump on and off the trams, metro and water buses so that we could explore further afield (Â£6 deposit and you buy top up for fares) It is an inexpensive way to get around and much cheaper than taxis We would love to experience the city again and would definitely want to revisit this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cinmarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the most perfect location in Istanbul! It's a 5 minute walk to the Basilica Cistern, Sophia Hagia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Archeological Museum. It is also near the oldest Turkish bath in Turkey, and walking distance to the Grand Bazaar. I could go and on of what is around. Most importantly, right around the corner we booked our tours and they even gave us a refund when we couldn't make it to one excursion. The hospitality is amazing in Istanbul! The hotel itself looks just like the pictures and has the best panoramic view! Its affordable, clean and absolutely perfect! It really exceeded our expectations. Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “No other affordable hotel has such a great 360 degree view of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mazing_GC
Reviews.Content: For 70 Euros a night for a standard twin room, you can't do better than this in Istanbul. The standard rooms are not spacious, but there's enough room for what you need and definitely clean. Most hotels in Sultanamet at this price are not going to give you an enormous room. But what is outstanding about this hotel is the rooftop view, 360% of Istanbul and within 5 minutes walk (really!) of the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Basilica Cistern. And the views of the Bosphorus from that rooftop are breathtaking. The floor below, with the restaurant where you have their generous and delicious breakfast, also has 360 views, so if you go in winter, you can still enjoy the view without being exposed to the elements. Halil Ibriham (reception) and Serkan Dogan (manager) provide excellent service and friendliness, way beyond the 3-4 star rating this hotel is given. There are thousands of hotels to choose from in Istanbul, but if this is your price range, don't pass this one by.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situation, good facilities, great views from restaurant”
Reviews.Author: budd4y
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, absolutely ideal situation, comfortable room, restaurant and roof terrace have breathtaking views. Hard to fault - lack of tea and coffee making facilities in room perhaps? Booked direct with hotel who provided free one way pick up from Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Some facts about Adamar hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaAlex
Reviews.Content: I searched a lot about Sultanahmet hotels and read lots of reviews before choosing Adamar hotel. And I never regretted about my choice. The hotel is very cosy and small as most of the hotels in this region. It is has a perfect location, just 2 min walking down the street to reach the main cultural objects, restaurants and bars to have a lunch or a dinner. Or just to get a tram which would take you to Taksim. I booked a standard room with a king size bed. Well yes, I have to admit that the room was small, as you can learn from other reviews, but you will not find a bigger standard room in any of those lil private hotels in this region. All of them are the same unless you book a better category. Anyway the room was very comfy, clean and modern! I have read a comment here of some traveller that he couldnt sleep at night bcz of the street noise. Well, you should understand that you gonna visit Istanbul, and all oriental cities as Istanbul are full of noise, car beeping and non-sleeping citizens at night. The breakfast was good. Someone said the food was the same every day. Well, what do you expect? Its a normal turkish buffet full of cheese, pastry, olives, vegetables, fruit salad etc.. Everybody says the toproof restaurant has an amazing view to the city - its a truth, the view is a breathtaking. I do advise this hotel to stay. I really enjoyed it! It has all the necessary conditions for a comfy accomodation. However if you faced problems with understanding, managment or the room ( it may happen in any hotel ) you can easily change the hotel, just do not pay for the hotel in advance, pay at the check out and you will be charged for as many nights as you stayed.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, great service, panoramic views, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: naomildeut
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package, but very pleasantly surprised. From the minute we got there felt welcomed, taken care of and comfortable. All the things that make for a great stay in a big city. Couldn't wait to get back to our attractive, clean room for a rest and a really good shower or bath after a day of exploring this fascinating city. The front desk and food servers made the trip even better with their friendly, caring manner. One day they made me a special healing Turkish yogurt soup which really cured me of an unsetltled stomach ! New Year's fireworks were splendid to view from the rooftop restaurant. i would definitely recommend this hotel when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to go with family, friends or as a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: lesleygomez
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff and price. We were very, very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, efficient, clean with a breathtaking view from the rooftop resturant”
Reviews.Author: MintWomble
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller hotel with a friendly feel. This hotel was great, with extremely efficient and friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble. The pick up service is to be recommended. Rooms are comfortable with modern spotless bathrooms. The highlight was the rooftop resturant with breathtaking views of Istanbul. My only regret was that I didnt bring my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonCheetham
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this boutique hotel in the old quarter, just a short walk from The Blue Mosque, Haghia Sofia and the Cistern to name but a few culural sites in close proximity. The staff were really friendly and helpful, the roof terrace and views an unexpected bonus and it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Snappy service, great restaurant, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: AK_Big_Guy
Reviews.Content: My wife, adult daughter and I spent 6 days here. The ride to and from the airport went without a hitch. The staff were VERY helpful. The location was ideal for visiting sites on the Golden Horn. For sites further afield, a tram station is only a couple blocks away. The included breakfast is presented in their top floor, view restaurant. The breakfast selections were exceptional. I loved the fresh tomatoes and the Turkish cheeses. The room size was fine for three adults (I am 2-meters tall) by European standards. The bathrooms were exceptional. There are restaurants, money changers and ATM within easy access. We slept well. For a real treat, have dinner on the room with some Turkish wine, exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Adamar - Istanbul GEM!”
Reviews.Author: SultanHussain
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel before and wanted to come back for the second time, and I have to say the level of service has been absolutely fantastic. The staff have been extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay - from our airport pick up to even assisting us in deciding upon our planned excursions. They are very efficient and there for whatever you require. What makes this hotel more special is the fantastic location - 2 minute walking distance from the Aya SofÄ±a and 3 minutes from the Blue Mosque. Additionally, the open roof restaurant (the food is great here!) has some of the most spectacular views of Istanbul - particularly at night. There are hundreds of other restaurants in the surrounding area, with a tram service just around the corner (believe me, this is much better than the London Underground!). I would seriously recommend this hotel to anyone. Whether you want a relaxing time, or appreciate travelling around the city, I believe this hotel provides the perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Love this one”
Reviews.Author: Johnnysfriend
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've been in. Small comfortable rooms, with balcony restaurant have the grrrrreat view of Istanbul, and ellegant service and delicious food of course. AND LOCATED NEAR 2 EVERY WHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings on the Adamar”
Reviews.Author: tastravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Istanbul and we stayed at the Adamar. I have mixed feelings about the hotel. Some things were so good...and some things were really wrong. Regrettably I have to give the hotel a thumbs down because it comes down to quality of sleep- and I got none! First the positives. The Adamar is in a great location and walkable to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, Grand Bazaar, and many other spots. It is very close to some good restaurants. The photos on the website don't lie- the rooftop view is amazing! The breakfast is more than adequate with a wide selection of hot and cold items. The service at the front desk was also great. The staff stored our luggage when we traveled to Cappadocia and booked a daytrip to Ephesus and a dance show for us. The rooms were on the small side, but bigger than a lot of European hotel rooms, and clean. They were simple but fine...UNLESS you really value your sleep! (The negatives) The rooms are LOUD. During the first part of our trip we were on the 2nd floor. The call to prayer never bothered us. It was the horrible street noise with buses and honking at all hours. And the plumbing. We could hear showers and toilets several floors above us. On our return after Cappadocia we stayed on the 5th floor and it was just as loud. You can hear every door open and close all night long. And we aren't light sleepers! Also as several other reviewers have mentioned, even when you request a "family room", you may get two single beds. We did and the only solution was to push the beds together, which wasn't really an option with the design of the room. Also, oddly, on the 2nd floor our shower had a floor to ceiling window in it. Since we were situated over a busy street, it was really a peep show when we showered. The Adamar is in a good location, but there are a bunch of other hotels nearby...and I would say keep looking so you can get some peace and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: T-on-Tour
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed for 4 nights in April but wanted to add a review as I rely on Tripadvisor so much! The room wasn't that big but it was comfortable and well laid out. The bed was comfortable and the shower was very effective. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly (they rang to confirm an airport shuttle bus for us), particularly the breakfast staff. The breakfast was nice (there wasn't a huge variety but it was more than sufficient) and when we asked for some more scrambled eggs we got 2 enormous plates! The highlight of the hotel is the stunning view from the rooftop terrace - we went up there twice a day just to look! The location was excellent, particularly for a first visit to Istanbul, close to all the major tourist sites and a short walk to the tram. There's so much to see and do in Istanbul, we definitely want to return. If we wanted to stay in the Sultanahmet area again I wouldn't hesitate to choose the Hotel Adamar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff made Istanbul our favourite city break.”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirelass58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for four nights to explore Istanbul's main attractions. The view from the roof terrace is amazing and the warm evening of our arrival made dinner up there an enjoyable experience in spite of the rather steep prices especially for the beer! The hotel is very well placed, near the tram for access to the boat pier and Galeta bridge and 2 mins walk from Hagia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. The area is very safe for a stroll from the hotel to the park by the Mosque where the fountain plays and families gather in the evening and we found many restaurants located in this area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room,although small, was spotless with comfortable beds and soft towels in the small shower room. Breakfast was generous and leisurely and the view from the panoramic restaurant magnificent! One of the best aspects of the hotel is it's boutique nature and the small number of guests who can be accommodated at a time in just 25 rooms. Thank you to the reviewers who directed us to book the Adamar, it was indeed an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ADpsufan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family holiday in Turkey. Chose the Adamar based on reviews here. Good: Location...for tourists it is the best. Walking distance to Blue Mosque, St. Sophia, Grand Bazaar, etc. Great restaurants also near by. For this reason alone the hotel is great. Rooftop... the rooftop view is unbelievable. Words honestly can not describe it. We made it a point everynight to have a drink and watch the lights come on in the city. Truly amazing. Service... the staff are great. Went out of their way to help. We arrived early at 8am and they got us into a room by 11am. Bought a cake for my son's birthday and sang to him. Just absolutely great people. Bad: Well more like areas to improve. Room size... narrow, especially the bathrooms. Don't know what can be done about it but if you are a large person, be prepared. Breakfast buffet... a little plain. Same food everyday. Same with rooftop menu. In a city of great food, it could use some improvement. The quality of the food was good, just could use more choices, especially Turkish dishes. Other then those small things we really enjoyed ourselves. Staff was great, as I mentioned, and made for a great trip. My kids really liked Istanbul. It is definitely a city worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: auldrockah
Reviews.Content: ideal for city break to istanbul. Great location. Plenty eateries and watering holes nearby. Short walk to Sultanahmet tram stop. Very clean and staff very friendly & helpful. rooftop restaurant gives great views down to the sea and the blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay for the best views in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: v0yager7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of very favourable Tripadvisor reviews and it more than lived up to our expectations. During our stay, it was reported on BBC News24 that the Chief Executive of Tripadvisor had advised users of this site to focus on "average" reviews and to pay rather less attention to horror stories or extremely glowing reports. So, in an attempt to make it clear that this review - though undoubtedly in the "glowing" category - is honest and objective, I shall begin with the relatively negative aspects. Four of us travelled together and we stayed in two standard double rooms. As other visitors to this hotel have previously reported, the rooms are really very small, as are the bathrooms. They are, however, immaculately clean and stylishly decorated. They have up-to-date TV sets (with a good selection of channels) and they are well lit. It is fair to state, however, that the Adamar also offers deluxe rooms and suites, which are undoubtedly more spacious, although I did not actually see inside any of them. The only other slightly negative aspect is that drinks at the hotel are rather more expensive than they are at any of the very nearby restaurants and cafes. Everything else about this hotel, however, is simply delightful. It is located in a fairly busy but relatively up-market part of the city. There are tram stops within easy walking distance. All of the major sites of Istanbul are within easy walking distance. The food is very good and varied. All parts of the Adamar are immaculately clean and well-decorated. But the Adamar's major selling point has simply got to be the rooftop terrace and restaurant, with the most stunning views of the city that you can possibly imagine - especially at night, when the Blue Mosque and other major buildings are illuminated...and they are not on the distant horizon, they are incredibly nearby. Just magical! As for the Adamar's staff, I would find it difficult to overstate just how friendly and helpful they were throughout our brief stay. A single example of their attentiveness should be enough, I hope, to make the point. We stayed in Istanbul for 8 days. Not having previously visited the city, we arranged our trip in such a way that we would change hotels midway through in order to familiarise ourselves with two different areas. We made the staff at the Adamar's reception desk aware of our plans and asked them to book a taxi for us to the new venue, which, of course, they did. What they also did, however, was to instruct a member of their staff to accompany us in the taxi to ensure that we we were taken directly to where we wished to go and that we were charged the correct (very cheap) fare. When we arrived, he insisted on carrying our luggage into the new hotel and introduced us (very nicely) at the reception desk. He then - refusing to accept a tip - walked back to the Adamar. Should we decide to pay a return visit to Istanbul we would not even consider staying anywhere but the Adamar. It is a lovely, perfectly located, very friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stinger63
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Adamar Hotel! As a first time solo traveler, I was a bit nervous about finding a place that was safe, clean, and affordable. The Adamar exceeded my expectations. I booked direct from their website and, with a 3 night stay, that entitled me to airport pick-up. It was wonderful to have all of that arranged in advance, so all I had to do was collect my luggage and find my driver. I stayed in Room 101, which was small but very nice. Being just one floor above street level made it a bit noisy--but not in a way that caused any distress. I slept so well in the comfortable bed--noise was not really a problem. The room was quite gorgeous and clean--and it had the nicest shower with the best water pressure of any place I'd stayed in Europe! So nice after spending my days walking around the city! The breakfast buffet was quite nice. All of the items were kept well stocked and were clearly fresh. I dined in the restaurant 2 evenings. The food was wonderful, the service even more so. Both evenings, there were large groups, so I was a bit worried about poor service since I was solo--but I still received tremendous service! The view from the rooftop was amazing, as was the little cafe/sitting area on the roof. So nice to sit with my tea and my Kindle one afternoon, relaxing after a day of sightseeing. The Adamar is perfectly located close to the major attractions and lots of cute little cafes. I especially enjoyed the House of Medusa cafe. I highly recommend this hotel and hope someday to visit thie city and the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: complicity71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2010 with my mother and sisters for 4 nights. Istanbul is a great city to visit, but we would not have had such a great trip were it not for Hotel Adamar! The hotel was lovely, rooftop restaurant amazing and staff were unbelievably friendly and helpful. All the major sights are within a 10 minute walk, so location is perfect too. Don't even think about staying anywhere else - I definitely plan to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Endlessly helpful, good natured staff in perfect central location.”
Reviews.Author: egreg44
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from the internet. The location was perfect, the rooms - although a little "compact" - were sleek and attractive with plenty of storage, and the rooftop terrace was spectacular. However, the best feature was definitely the staff who were, without exception, helpful, friendly and good natured. Good value for money and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with the best view and most caring service in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: emeleeJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 08h00 and our room was ready almost immediately, although we had not advised on early checking. Upstairs open deck has a breaktaking view over all of Istanbul. Spent perfect hours here drinking in the views and atmosphere and enjoying the Hotel fare. Small rooms, but so were all the others we stayed in in Istanbul. Ideal location for Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar. On public tranport routes to most of the rest of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are accurate- Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Jlar1
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul so I wanted to be in a location that would be near to all the main sights...the Adamar meets that requirement perfectly. The single room that I rented was the perfect size for one person and opposed to other single rooms I have stayed in this was not pokey in the slightest and had a nice light and airy feeling to it. Bed was good, shower was powerful enough, safe and minibar.....everything you need. The staff are very friendly and the breakfast is decent enough. The rooftop terrace is very nice with stunning views. Overall I would go back alone or accompanied and i hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff, comfortable room, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: CandR40
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend the Adamar Hotel for its central location, comfortable room and very helpful and knowledgeable staff. The rooftop restaurant has a wonderful panoramic view of the city . We took great photos of Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous while enjoying our excellent buffet breakfast and were able to have a late snack there overlooking the wonderful panorama of Istanbul by night.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABPL
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in Istanbul, we were told that unfortunately the hotel had overbooked and there was no room for us for the first night... Normally this would mean a travel disaster but not with the Adamar Hotel. The hotel immediately informed us of the problem and said that it was their fault. They had made a booking for us at another - 4* - hotel ont far from the Adamar Hotel. We were taken there in a private taxi and asked what time we wanted to be picked up the next morning to transfer back to the Adamar Hotel. At the other hotel, we had full use of all facilities including the Turkish Bath and a very nice room. When we returned to the Adamar Hotel the next morning, we were told that due to the mistake we would be given a deluxe room which was also a lovely room. If this wasn't enough, we were also given a complimentary transfer back to the airport at the end of our stay in Istanbul. The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast was held in the hotel's restaurant with a brilliant view of the Bosphorous. They also had a roof top terrace which we sat on each morning before heading out back into Istanbul. The rooftop terrace had a superb view of the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Overall, we can not recommend the Adamar Hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for the city tourist who wants to have it all!”
Reviews.Author: newcomer76
Reviews.Content: It was our first family holiday in Instanbul. This hotel was near to all the sights , so no taxi needed. The views from the top of the hotel were breathtaking. We stayed in a family room and had no problems. Staff very friendly and happy to help with a smile. The room was small but if all you want to do is crash at night this is the place for you. The room was clean with white sheets and always kept hygenic and tidy. Would definately recommend this hotel. One snag you could hear the bathroom being used by the floor above but that doesnt bother you as the room above is also a family room so as usual there is a queue for the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Emandbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days, long enough to get a real sense of how well a hotel functions, and the Adamar came up trumps in all respects. The entire staff, from reception to waiters to cleaners, were unfailingly friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was varied and plentiful, and the location (right in the middle of Sultanameht) perfect for sightseeing, with the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace just minutes away on foot - though it could take a lot longer if you stopped to talk to every street trader and restaurateur who greeted you! We ate 3 times at the Panoramic Restaurant on the top (literally) of the hotel and both the food and the views were superb. The rooms were modern, spotless, the air conditioning efficient, free internet access - all in all this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good All Round”
Reviews.Author: kingfisherCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem in a quiet street near all the main routs(trams, buseses and taxis). The outdoor lounge on the 6th floor is really breathtaking. All the main sights can be seen, all with a cold beer in hand. The rooms are on the small side but are modern and clean. Bathrooms are modern and hygienic. The staff are friendly and extremely accomodating. A little gem in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JonnyStirling
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated and close to all the sights and places of interest. Good infrastructure to access all areas of the city. Friendly and helpful staff, especially Erhan, who seem to enjoy looking after you. Rooms are too small but manageable and who stays in their room anyway. All things considered i would return and recommend to friends but would ask for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “OUSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Roaming1Rosie
Reviews.Content: The Adamar really is a great value hotel and I can't fault it at all. Our room was a delightful twin on the second floor that was while not huge, perfectly adequate for our needs. It was also very nicely finished with soft furnishings and the bathroom was lovely also. (I don'y go away to stay in my hotel room, who does?) The roof terrace really has really quite incredible views of the Blue Mosque, a perfect place to enjoy a Mohito before setting out for the evening. The restaurant also enjoys magnificent views and it was a joy to have breakfast over looking the city. The Breakfast was to my taste but I can understand why some other guests may not be over keen. Lovely fresh fruits, cereals and breads with some hot local items and eggs. Selection of local meats and cheese that I really enjoyed with the olives. The location was ideal. Turn right out of the front door past the bightly painted buildings to the end of the road, turn right and right again and you will be in the middle of all types of Cafe's and bar's that at night look so invtining and lovely. The Blue Mosque is straight ahead down the road and there !!! Grand bazzar 10 mins relaxed walk...Yet the hotel was on a quite road with a village feel...IDEAL location. The Staff were all brilliant and nothing was too much trouble and the service we recieved was top notch. Halil, and the rest of the team were really very good. When we checked we both expected the bill to be far higher than it was. We had drinks on the terrace (didn't hold back) over the five days along with other drinks and bits to eat. The Adamar really is 5* for value and quality given the location and price. We have already decided to go back, just have to decide the date.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated for all the main tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Northernlight50
Reviews.Content: Small, well appointed hotel situated in Sultanahmet within easy walking distance of the main tourist attractions and close proximity to the tram line when you wish to venture further afield.The roof terrace was a perfect spot to sit with a drink and watch the sunset over the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and during daytime hours provided a really good view over the city and Bosphorous. The basic room was on the small size, but adequate nonetheless and deluxe rooms were availble in the hotel should more space be required. Whilst you could hear the hustel and bustle from the street below durign the day (only to be expected in a hotel in this central location) the noise level was not enough to keep you awake at night time. Customer service was of a high standard and delivered by staff who were polite and helpful at all times. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Would be very happy to return and stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: AprilSurrey
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this delightful hotel for three nights. The wonderful welcome extended our whole stay. All staff, especially in the restaurant were always friendly, efficient and helpful. The location is very good as stated for many historical sites, quiet with shops and small restaurants nearby. We ate in the hotel restaurant each evening as the panoramic views could not be beaten and the food good. Our room was not large but adequate, very comfortable, clean and bright with ensuite shower. A very good hotel for our city break which we would be happy to recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “Bijou hotel in a perfect location with brilliant staff.”
Reviews.Author: JohnandTuula
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for a tourist. It has a small reception and bar area, four floors above with five rooms each and four floors, a restaurant on the sixth floor and a roof terrace. Our double room was small but well designed with a small wardrobe, safe and mini-bar. The ensuite bathroom had no bath, but had a good shower. The bed was comfortable and the bed linen of good quality. The whole hotel was well kept. Buffet breakfast in the restaurant had a good variety of Turkish fare. The view from the restaurant and the roof terrace could not be bettered. Apart from the view the outstanding thing about this hotel is the staff. Every staff member whom we met was friendly, cheerful, and helpful.
