The receptionists were the best that I have ever encountered, from calling taxis and making reservations for us to giving information and advice, they excelled.

Reviews.Title: “The view which is superb and the location are really worth staying here for.”
Reviews.Author: GSAR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location really close to all of the main sites. The roof terrace really makes the hotel - extraordinary reviews. Good food and attentive staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable but not big.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better hotels with less money”
Reviews.Author: hackeritsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends. We had booked a double room & a triple room for 3 days (total cost:740 euros). Instead we got a single(probably) room with extra bed & a double room with extra bed. The rooms - especially the "double"- were too small with small baths and didn't reflect the money we paid. When the receptionist asked us how we found the room and I told him they were rather small & inappropriate to be consindered as double rooms and to the price we paid, he answered he could show me ... a smaller one if I wanted! The breakfast buffet was also rather poor & small with no fresh fruits & no variety, no omelets, no bacon, far away from the buffet our common friend described, but I must admit the best thing on that buffet were the stuffed pancakes. The suggestion of the hotel to eat to a good restaurant was totally far away of what we expected to find - we wanted to eat fresh fish & lobster spaghetti, but the price was twice higher as in Greece!!! - and the same for the hamam nearby (we had made a reservation for four for the last night and as we got to the place, we landed suddenly on earth -thank God- & cancelled it right away). The personel was friendly and cordial, the view from the roof was beautiful - can't argue with that - but, in general, comparing this hotel to the other hotels I've stayed in Rome, Madrid, Vienna, Amsterdam, I've stayed in better hotels and better rooms (double or triple) with less money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But A Bit Over Hyped”
Reviews.Author: RailwayHobo
Reviews.Content: My ears picked up when, on the morning of our arrival, I heard the clerk at the front desk advising some satisfied guests who were checking out how they should go about publishing their comments about the hotel at Tripadvisor. Given that I had chosen this hotel based on its high ratings from TripAdvisor, I immediately realized that management was doing its bit to manage its image. That said I would probably return to this hotel if I wanted to stay in Istanbul again in the Sultanahmet region, i.e., close to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia and other primary tourist attractions. A little background on my visit. I and a friend were stopping in Istanbul mid way on an overland rail journey from London to Tehran. This involved our arriving a little after 8:00 a.m. on a Tuesday morning and leaving just before midnight the following night. As a result I had booked one room for three nights in order to insure that we had a place to crash and clean up for our entire day and a half in Istanbul and a second room for one night for my friend to sleep in. Here are my pro's and con's on this property. Pro's The hotel manager, Serkan Dogan, was extremely responsive during the reservations process which was much appreciated. The promised complimentary car and driver were duly waiting for us when our train arrived at the Sirkeci train station some 45 minutes late. The staff were cordial and friendly. The rooms were not as small as I had fear and the bathrooms perfectly acceptable. The restaurant on the roof provided a decent breakfast (which was included) and served a very decent lunch. The view from the restaurant (including an open air dining area on the roof itself) were totally spectacular. At â‚¬89 a night (even considering that I had to book one room for three full nights), the price was fairly reasonably. Con's We had checked into the room that we had reserved for three full days upon arrival. When the time came that afternoon for my friend to check into the second room which we had reserved for one night only, we discovered that the hotel had overbooked and that the second room was no longer available. This happened despite the fact that we had specifically reserved two rooms for the Tuesday night over three months earlier and we had even confirmed our intent to check into the second room later in the day when we checked into our first room on Tuesday morning. While I considered this overbooking unacceptable, my friend was happy to be transferred across the street to a lesser hotel rather than make an issue of this. They offered no concession or discount in exchange for our willingness to help them overcome their own mistake. In addition, we had about four days worth of laundry done by the hotel; the total charge was about â‚¬120 which, in my book, is pretty expensive for wash and fold.

Reviews.Title: “cannot recommend the Adamar highly enough”
Reviews.Author: chatter2food
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul - long awaited so we chose the Adamar based on reviews and paid for the sea view. But we got so much more - helpful and friendly staff, clean modern rooms, great bar and terrace with the most stunning views imaginable. But importantly we were caught by the infamous 'volcanic plume' and the staff all helped as much as they could. Minor criticism was that we could here the plumbing in other rooms - but very minor indeed. Will definitely go back to Istanbul and to the Adamar.

Reviews.Title: “good quality, nice atmosphere, breath taking view”
Reviews.Author: PeterArnhem
Reviews.Content: A fair price - quality balance in this hotel and a huge extra : in the restaurant of the hotel or on the roof ( where you ca enjoy a drink or diner) you have a breathtaking view on the Aya Sofia and the Sultanahmet mosk. Besides that, the atmosphere in the hotel is warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Staff and Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: SH60
Reviews.Content: This smal hotel is the best choice for travellers wanting doorstep access to major sights, brilliant roof top views and being made to feel special by everyone in the hotel. Top floor restaurant and rooftop terrace give amazing views over the Bosphorous and the very close by attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palce and Cistern)

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel with spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: LesleyMpls
Reviews.Content: The Adamar Hotel is everything you need and nothing you don't. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our luggage was lost and they handled all of the discussions with the airline. The rooms are clean and very nice. The location is suburb - a few minutes from Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque and the tram, etc. To top it off, the view from the restaurant and rooftop patio is amazing. You get a 360 view of Istanbul. We spent a lot of time on the roof, even in March. I dream about the views everyday. I would go back to the Adamar in a heartbeat. I highly recommend the Adamar Hotel. Did I mention the rooftop views? Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tirilalli
Reviews.Content: this small hotel has lots of charm. Its main atout is that it is perfectly located on walking distance (less than 5 minutes) to Aghia Sophia, Blue mosque and Topkapi, and also not far from Bazar. Tramway is also very close, which allows you to access quickly all places of interest without the hassle of traffic. all around small restaurants and losts of boutiques. Hotel itself is very good, though rooms are quite small, but very well equiped with everything you need in the bathroom, even toothbrush and toothpaste, which is quite rare. Beds are very confortable, and there is free Wi-Fi in the rooms. The breakfast in panoramic restaurant is very nice, with quite a big choice. You should also try the restaurant at night, as the view of illuminated Aghia Sophia, Blue mosque and Bosphore is amazing, and quite romantic. The food is very nice too and prices fair for what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: loveholidaylife
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Adamar after reading many customer reviews on Trip advisor and Expedia. It had fantastic reviews on both sites and so we were not expecting to have any problems. However, unfortunately, our stay did not get off to a good start as we were informed when we first arrived that the hotel had over-booked itself and so we would have to stay in a different hotel close by for 2 nights (50% of our trip). The hotel had apparently failed to see the fax Expedia sent through with our booking. The hotel did at least accept that it was their mistake rather than try to blame it on Expedia, but it was a very disappointing start to our stay when we had spent so long researching hotels and chosen to stay at the Adamar specifically. We were placed in the Hotel Le Piano for 2 nights which was fine and well managed, but we felt probably a slightly cheaper hotel. When we finally moved across to the Adamar after two nights, we were shown two rooms to choose from. We chose room 501 which was a small room but had great views of the bosphorous. I think the hotel probably did give us the best of their standards rooms but I donâ€™t think they gave us a room upgrade to compensate for our inconvenience as we were not offered one of the panoramic circular rooms which are clearly the more expensive rooms. Furthermore, after complaining upon our initial arrival we were offered a free airport transfer for our return flight. However, when it came to the end of our stay and they realised we were flying from the further away airport of Istanbul Sabina gocen rather than Ataturk this offer was withdrawn. The hotel did offer us free dinner at the hotel but we had found the breakfast at the hotel average so did not particularly want to have dinner at the hotel as well. We never met the manager of the hotel, despite having asked to see him upon on our initial arrival. I would have expected a manager to personally apologise for such an error as it is a small hotel, rather than leave his staff to deal with the problem. I am sure you can have a good stay at the Adamar as it has a great location and fantastic views and some good staff such as the waitress at breakfast. However, perhaps as the hotel is not used to dealing with unhappy customers it did not manage to do enough to win us over after making such a big initial mistake of placing us in a different hotel for half of our trip. Having had to complain at the start of our stay and then be dissatisfied when the offer of a complimentary airport transfer was withdrawn created an uncomfortable atmosphere between us and the staff which affected the pleasantness of our stay for the 2 nights we were actually in the Adamar. I would certainly not recommend booking the hotel through Expedia as it clearly does not have a fail safe booking system with them.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here - you can't beat the great views and good value”
Reviews.Author: FussyBrighton
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Istanbul - the jaw-dropping panoramic views from the 6th Floor Breakfast Room are enough to justify the room rate alone (which is extremely good value for money anyway). Look one way and there's the Blue Mosque, the other way and there's Aya Sophia and Topkapi (all a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel) and really be impressed by the sweeping panorama across the Golden Horn to Beyoglu. Even the most critical visitor would describe these views as stunning. Our bedroom (ordinary Sultanahmet street views from here on 1st Floor) was very clean and comfortable (though a bit Ikea back catalogue if more luxury decor matters to you) but far better standard than you'd get for the same price in most tourist areas in other parts of Europe. Also, as well as free Wi-Fi in the hotel, should you not have your laptop with you (and we didn't) there is a desktop computer with access to the internet and printing facilities all free of charge for guests in the hotel bar. The staff are very helpful, efficient (and English-speaking) too. Without doubt, we would stay here again and recommend it to others on a similar short sightseeing break to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Cahaholland
Reviews.Content: Adamar was a very good hotel for a good price. Friendly and very helpful staff. Nice, clean rooms and sanitair. You can walk to all the interesting places from the hotel. Haga Sofia is a 5 minutes walk. You have a wonderful view from the dining and breakfast room over Istanbul. Escacially in the evening it was great. In the evening it was very quiet in the room; no traffic noise. 8,5 for this hotel. Caty en Hans from Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Do not look anywere else. This is the best location”
Reviews.Author: failler
Reviews.Content: Let put the facts straight: This is not a fancy hotel but this hotel has all the features I am looking for that is: Best location, clean room, dedicated staff and, best cost/value ratio. Roof top is a must. I took my morning coffee and evening beer at that place each day as the view is unbelievable. This view worth the price of my stay. I strongly recommend that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with stunning roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: Myopinioncounts56
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for five nights in March 2010. We were upgraded to one of the corner rooms (302). Every morning after breakfast, we took our coffees up to the roof terrace and both of us immediately developed massive grins on our faces. It is an absolutely fabulous setting overlooking the Sultanameht area, with the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia so close by. We think the hotel should install a webcam so people can see just how fantastic the view is. Its central location meant we could easily return here during the day to rest prior to going out again. The staff were very professional, well turned out and friendly. Excellent service all round from the front desk staff, to the restaurant staff, to the room staff to the bell hop. Free access to wireless internet. I would be very happy to return here with my wife and children, and so would my brother (but with his wife and children). This is unusual for us as we both like exploring new places - but this hotel is very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience: from perfect location for a tourist, modern, clean, friendliest staff, panoramic restaurant ....”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Frog1
Reviews.Content: I had read good reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor but the experience exceeded our expectations. Best location in the old town (Sultanhamet): minutes from the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Underground Cistern.... walking distance from the port, the Spice Market etc. On top of that friendliest staff ever (special thanks to Halil at the reception desk), very clean and modern. Nice decoration. Some rooms are a little small (the ones ending in 01 and 03) but the price is very reasonable for the overall quality. Great views from the panoramic restaurant and the roof top terrace. Example of neat attentions: they will stamp and mail your postcards for you, they can arrange for the hotel shuttle to drive you to the airport at a good price. In conclusion, you get a 5 star service without the price tag, in a friendly atmosphere from everybody on staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AFuk
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location and this hotel has the most amazing views of the city, both from the bar and the stunning roof top. Although it was too cold to actually eat outside, we were still able to go ontop of the roof an admire the views across the city. The staff here are fantastic and couldnt be more friendly or helpful! The actual room we had was slightly smaller than I am used to, but it was not an issue and was fine for what we required- a base to explore this great city! The room itself has everything you need and it does not suffer from any noise issues at all! We didnt eat at the hotel (apart from breakfast, which was good), but we did enjoy some drinks at the bar and this gives you great views of the city, particularily at sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Yantabulla
Reviews.Content: There isn't much more that I can add to the reviews already written except to say that this hotel has the sweetest staff I have come across. From reception to the cleaners & restaurant staff they were superb. The location just up from the Basilica Cistern is perfect. Close to the tourist attractions & the trams. Don't miss the view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Unbelievable View! Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: EsmeAbroad
Reviews.Content: The Adamar Hotel is an incredible hotel, from the comfortable rooms, to the splendorous breakfast, to the extremely helpful and friendly staff. We were amazed at the great location for such a reasonable price; it was only a 5 minute walk from the Hagia Sophie and the Blue Mosque. Halil the concierge was always friendly and helpful, even though we often asked questions he was patient and would help us with everything, right down to phoning places for information for us. He booked appointments for us at the hamami and restaurants without questions asked. The rooftop restaurant was incredible, I can't imagine better views. We always felt safe walking in the area even at nighttime. We would recommend anyone to stay at the Adamar and will stay there again when we go back. They made our stay in Turkey a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel DID reply to emails!”
Reviews.Author: Harrowian
Reviews.Content: In an earlier review "No replies to emails", I said that I had not received a repy to two emails. The hotel have sent copies of emails that they sent. As it was not their faut that I did not receive them, this review seeks to redress what was, unwittingly, an unfair impression of the hotel's customer service. Apologies to the Adamar. Ratings made without a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the View ...”
Reviews.Author: westlon
Reviews.Content: Booked because off Tripadvisor this hotel , central Located , Price very reasonable , staff friendly and Brekfast sufficient , rooms are on the smaller side , but most hotels in Istanbul are but if you see the View from the top or one below down from the Restaurant / Breakfast room you know this is the hotel ! Awesome , would book anytime again , clean and good neighbourhood , trams easy access and all walking distance too the Main sights .

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: rooks786
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Adamar Hotel during for a week during April 2009. We completely fell in love with Istanbul and this hotel added substantially to the experience. The rooms are unfortunately extremely small. But the location and proximity to all the major sites and the tram make it rather worthwhile. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast adequate. The views of the Hagia Sophia at breakfast are amazing. Our only gripe was the lift which wasnt operational every so often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fk79London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December and had an enjoyable stay. Well located with competent, friendly staff. I would recommend staying! Some points 1. Pick from airport was a little late: on arrival, an apology should have been made, however this was an oversight, not rudeness. But pick up service, whilst generally avaliable, is useful. 2. Rooms are small, but meet your needs - clean and comfortable. 3. Breakfast is fine: fresh fruit, and good hot options. The view from the restaurant is excellent. 4. All the main sites in Sulthanahmet and tram station are a walking distance. 5. Advice to staff: All good and well recommending the Omar Restaurant when guests seek advice - but show a little less bias and advise based on your own local experience please! 6. Free Wifi - good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in Central location”
Reviews.Author: melbchristine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adamar Hotel for 4 nights in the first week of November. The location is fantastic, within walking distance to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. The tram is only a couple of blocks away. Our room was small, but neat and very clean. Breakfast was in the upstairs restaurant and was very enjoyable with the best views in town. All staff were very friendly and helpful, and nothing was too much trouble for them. I think it was the best hotel around, modern, yet also traditional. Internet in the lobby was free, you just need to obtain a password from the front desk. Elevator was small (only holds two people), but that wasn't a big problem. The only negative thing I have to say is that we were recommended to go to "Sultana's" restaurant. It cost about $80AUD per head (very expensive for Turkey). The restaurant staff picked us up and drove us back, but I would definitely not go there again. The food and show were very average. But there are no complaints about Adamar, we would definitely recommend this to our friends and stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: forecaster
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with excellent location and good value for money. Very good for sightseeing, all historical places are located very close to hotel. Our room was 305, we stayed from 26 till 30 November. Many thanks to hotel staff for good time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: amychung
Reviews.Content: we stayed there 4 nights ,it was excellent holiday there in Istanbul , the adamar hotel was nice ,near GREAT SULTANAHMET MOSQUE and also HAGIA SOPHIA, everythings are just so close so i think the best location of istanbul .... the guys there were helpfull espcially the nights workers so helpfull the guy at receptions i dont remember the names of him but probably all of them are ok, thanks those guys , i really recommend you to stay there if you go to istanbul ,

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were right!- Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Froulis
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews i read and i was fully satisfied. The location is fantastic to visit all the tourist attractions, tram line close to hotel was also very convenient to move around the city. Rooms were great and bathroom new and spotlesly clean.bed extra comfortable and extra large! Staff was very friendly. Breakfast staff more than great!, attentive and friendly. Recommendations from frond desk could have been better. Ask for a room on high floor because there is noise from the streets on the lower floors. Overall a fantastic city, alive and hospitable. Would definately recommend Adamar and look forward to my next stay with them! Stavros

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Samsarabiker
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul was lovely, thanks of Adamar's staff who gave us a very warm welcome. They are very nice and friendly and speak different languages to make the guest feel like at home. The hotel is a restored building, so you've got the classic style combined with brand new interior. Amazing views from the top where is the hotel's restaurant. Nicely decorated in Turkish style. Our room wasn't very big but it was brilliant. And, something very important, the location. Just a nice 5 minutes walk to Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and about 10 minutes to the Grand Bazaar. Lots of restaurants and shops around. We recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Sammy042
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be in a better location for visiting all the places of interest in the old town. The rooms were nicely furnished, comfortable, and spotlessly clean, and all the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The restaurant on the 6th floor has stunning views over the city, and the roof terrace above it is the perfect place to relax and take in the panoramic views. The lunchtime and evening food was excellent and good value for money. I would happily recommend this hotel to my friends, and when I next visit wonderful Istanbul, I will definitely stay at the Adamar.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel in prefect location”
Reviews.Author: janpki
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with some friends for a city break for 6 days. Booking via expedia gave as a really good rate. Excellent location in middle of historic district, less than 5 min walk to Hagia Sophia. Very friendly service with perfect English. Rooms smallish and slightly noisy. Breakfast mainly continental style, still reasonable and thanks to being on roof terrace with view over city already reason enough to stay at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel in great location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Chose this property from reviews on TA and not disappointed at all! This is a small corner Boutique Hotel in Istanbul about 1 block from the Blue Mosque and near everything else you need to see in Istanbul. It is walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, St. Sophia, The T.Palace, and shops and restaurants. We arrived in Istanbul via cruise ship NCL Jade (cruise from Athens to Istanbul - I do not recommend NCL, that's another review) and took a cab from the pier to the hotel at an extremely high rate of 25Euros. Be careful and settle on an amount for any taxi before you board the cab. In general all businesses including taxis want Euros not Turkish Liras. Some take USD. It should not cost more than 40TL from port to this hotel. If you believe you are overcharged, do not pay the driver until you reach your hotel and ask the front desk clerk, Halil - a wonderful man - to restate your fare. Turkish businessmen are extremely pushy and intimidating. Do not fall for it. Upon checking out, Have Halil call a legitimate taxi for you. The hotel is small with approximately 6 rooms on each floor (5floors) but quite cozy and very very friendly. The entire staff is at your service at all times! We arrived before the 3pm check in time but Halil had the bellhop take and secure our bags until the first room would be available for us around 12noon. Excellent service. They offered apple tea, internet useage and a comfortable lobby to wait. (Free WiFi in all rooms - ask for user id and password) We chose to walk the town a bit where Halil directed us. Halil does his best in speaking English and Spanish and any other language that may present itself. Our room was #504 - a King standard room. It was small in size but comfortable for two people. Flat screen TV with good selection of multi-lingual channels, minibar, safe and a nice size bathroom. One and only complaint was the very hard beds. A suggestion to this hotel is that they place featherbeds on the beds to make them more comfortable. Upon our entry to our room, we noticed the lock did not work and was assured it would be corrected immediately - it was within the next hour. The bathroom contained toiletries such as the usual body and hair washes, lotion, sewing kit, two toothpaste and toothbrush kits, caps, soaps, etc. Bathroom is of normal size with hand-held shower option. Very clean. Shoe polish supplies and slippers were also provided in the closet. The elevator is really very small and tight - only two people and a bag fit. Hotel restaurant is on the 6th floor - Panoramic Restaurant. This restaurant has a beautiful view of the entire city - especially of the Blue Mosque. They also have a rooftop area that was closed due to cold weather. We had breakfast daily here ((ask for a latte instead of the regular coffee - this and breakfast included in rate) and dinner twice - by candlelight and star-twinkling ceiling lights. Food and wine are excellent. Menus available in three languages, Turkish, Spanish and English. The servers are great and friendly! A recommendation regarding the Grand Bazaar - it is very hectic to buy there as the vendors start off with a ridiculous high price and then finally end up lowering it to your offering price. Some are very rude and insult you - don't take it personally, just walk away. It appears they will chase you down and accept your offer. Watch out for the stories of the "inexpensive leather" accessories. You can buy leather goods cheaper in the states. Negotiate these prices down the the bear bones. Also, I found the Spice Bazzar a better place to purchase anything. They have all that the Grand Bazaar has with the exception of gold shops. The gold is extremely expensive and they ask in Euros. Save some money visit the Grand Bazaar but buy at the Spice Bazaar - you can haggle at the Spice Bazaar too although they are pretty set on their prices. I recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have the time of their lives in the beautiful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location...Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Zeshan
Reviews.Content: The Adamar was a joy to stay in. From the excellent location to the well appointed rooms. But the best thing about the Adamar were its staff. They were brilliant ..friendly knowledgeable and very very helpful taking care of everything we needed. They made the stay so much better ...Special Thanks to Husnu... Halil & Gokhan who were outstandingâ€¦exceptional Customer Serviceâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Adamar is excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: pentadragao
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, the best choice in Istanbul. The service was superb, reservations, welcome and transfer arrangements were done to perfection by the reception staff, breakfast was good, rooms were confortable and impecably clean, the location simply can't be better and the terrasse view is breathtaking. There is some noise from the street, but if you want peace and quiet you shouldn't stay right in the heart of frantic Sulthanamet. All in all, thank you Adamar for a terrific holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need from a hotel and more”
Reviews.Author: yeldnats
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay. Visited with my son. We were so impressed that we would not hesitate to bring back the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Cathns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in September and canâ€™t fault it. We were upgraded to a larger room on the fifth floor â€“ loads of room, lovely dÃ©cor, and great views of Aya Sophia. Staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, breakfast was wonderful, and we also had a very good meal on the restaurant terrace, again with amazing views. Sultanahmet is full of tourists, which was bit of a negative point for us (we usually try to stay off the beaten path) but handy to get to some of the main sites in Istanbul. Adamar comes highly recommended, good value for money and a good jumping off point for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Adamar's location & helpfulness of staff make it a winner”
Reviews.Author: chrisnikmanchester
Reviews.Content: Adamar Hotel is located in the historic Sultanahmet district of Istanbul within 5 minutes walk of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Moreover, the 360 degree views from their rooftop are unrivalled-we could see our cruise ship docked a couple miles away!! Staff are friendly and helpful from arrival to departure; manager, reception, restaurant, porter-all giving their time and service with a sincere willingness and open smiles. The bedroom I was allocated on the 4 th floor was clean & fresh with huge windows (with blackout blinds and venetians if required). The room was a small twin with a tiny but well appointed en suite shower room-if you crave space this may not be for you so ask for a larger bedroom. Breakfast buffet is really good with wide choice-cereals, juices, fruit, breads, yoghurts, cheeses & boiled eggs & lashings of tea/coffee. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SBSCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, my stay at the Adamar Hotel Sultanahmet in Istanbul was one the highlights of my 2 week travels in Turkey. Every aspect of this hotel was perfection: The rooms elegant, tasteful, spotlessly clean, quiet and well maintained. Rooms were also very quiet and well-sound proofed from both outdoor and indoor noise. The location was absolutely the best place to be in Istanbul - steps away from the tram, buses, mosques and top places for sightseeing. But what made my stay really outstanding was every staff member working at the Adamar. I could really feel the warm and genuine sense of family they had. The owner and General Manager Hasan Ekman was available, accessable and very involved with hotel operations, welcoming any questions or concerns. He was equally available and supportive to his staff. At the front desk, Halil (7am-7pm) was incredibly kind, helpful and patient, never tiring of answering all our questions! Even the waitstaff during breakfast service were attentive and efficient. Speaking of breakfast, the breakfast at the Adamar was amazing, and it was served on the top floor affording an incredible view of the city. There had been a review in the past about the 5th floor being noisy (due to a rare special event in the dining room one floor above), and the hotel has since corrected this problem. To try: Inciralti Kebap ve Pide Salonu - a small restaurant around the corner to the right, with excellent lentil soup, bread, meze and dessert, all very affordable. To avoid: the Sultanahmet Hamami - although the actual services were OK, the place had a creepy vibe, someone was smoking near the entrance, and would not recommend going alone.(A friend and I had found this one on our own). Instead, stay with the staff recommendations for turkish baths, and you won't go wrong. Overall, I cannot imagine a more perfect hotel and location in Istanbul, and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: TheBlackWidow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night break in Istanbul, staying at the Adamar, which I chose having read about it here. 2 mins from the Basilica Cistern and Haghia Sophia, 5 mins from the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace and 10 - 15 mins to the Grand Bazaar. The roof terrace was a joy. Sitting up there with a drink, looking out over the Golden Horn, listening to the Call to Prayer all around us was an unforgettable experience. The rooms were comfortable and clean, with a free safe and nice en-suite bathroom, air con and good double glazing (although the busy side streets are much quieter at night). Free internet access plus use of the printer in reception was great, as I was able to check in and print boarding cards for our return flight. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening, but had breakfast up there. The buffet wasn't huge but was plenty for us - I liked the apricot and orange muffins a lot! The waiter and waitress were attentive, topping up our coffee regularly, and were polite enough not to giggle at my attempts to say thank you in Turkish. My only complaint (and it is a teeny, weeny one) was the piped music on the roof terrace and in the restaurant, which I could have done without. All in all, a great base for a memorable city break. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Bluebells11
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Adamar do everything they can to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.The buffet breakfast was probably the weakest link in the chain but still more than adequate. Dinner was excellent, costing only slightly more than local restaurant prices but having a better selection on the menu. The dining room came with a fantastic 360 degree view of Istanbul both day and night as did the roof terrace. Our room was smartly decorated, clean and well serviced but with limited hanging space. Being in the heart of the old city, the hotel is a short distance walk from the main attractions of the area. Local shops and restaurants were a little disappointing and we felt better value for money could be had in the new town. The tram system, although congested, is quick, clean, cheap and regular. If you are travelling light [only hand luggage] we thought the tram used in conjunction with the Metro to be the best way to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Trustworthy, Friendly and Affordable - Well done Adamar!”
Reviews.Author: Griswaldsgovacation
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate booking your stay here as you won't be disappointed! We were a group of 11 staying in 5 rooms and we received wonderful service, clean efficient rooms and good food - especially try the pesto pasta as it's a delicious surprise! Each staff is very pleasant and warm and go out of their way to ensure your comforts are looked after. We found all the sites we wanted to visit to be within walking distance of this hotel. The open air roof-top terrace was a welcome gathering place for a.m. coffee and late night drinks and viewing. There were no unwelcome surprises with the Adamar, only warm pleasant memories to tap into when reality bites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaRoseanna
Reviews.Content: Recently returned to Istanbul and for the 2nd year in succession and I stayed at the Adamar Hotel. It's a lovely boutique hotel in the best location; all the major attractions are within walking distance and it's close to the tram so a perfect location to access everything. The staff are wonderful and the rooftop gives a great view of the city across the Bosphorus. Although the rooms are small the service, breakfast and location makes up for it. Can definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: travelerNatalia
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel so much , its very small one , as all hotels in this area, it has very good location just one min away from all the places you would like to go ... Has nice view from the windows.. really beautiful ! the room is nice and clean , well.. they save on the soups and these small things:) I did not like the quality of these stuff .. but its fine as long as its good room and very nice staff.. very cozy and near to everything ,, really good value for the price , actually , ido not think you would find something better than this with this rate .. there are some small hotels with better rooms and looks , but the rate will be 200 per night .. this one I would recoment for my friends, and stay myself in this hotel again and again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in the historical centre with superb views from the roof terrace, clean, modern,excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: JDRD
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day trip. This hotel provided a great base with clean modern facilities. Some rooms are on the small side as is the case in many cities but had all that was required, comfy clean environment wellserviced..The staff where very helpful and spoke excellent English. Halil, the reception clerk, was friendly and provided us with information whenever we asked for it and organised a great Turkish Bath for us. Internet is available either downstairs in reception or by WiFi. Whilst most rooms look out onto the street the roof terrace where buffet breakfasts are served and where you can get an excellent evening meal has a stunning panoramic view of the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Topikapi Palace and with views across the Sea of Marmaris. Having a drink and relaxing on the sofas was also a lovely way to end a hard days sight seeing. The food was excellent with good choice between local cuisine and more traditional western food for all taste. The service was excellent and we were made to feel very special at each visit with friendly professional staff. The location meant you could pop out in an evening and enjoy the street scenes, sample the numerous local cafes and restaurants and view the Blue Mosque and Hippadrome when the big tour groups had gone home! The hotel is a few hundred yards away from most of the major historical sites, Hippadrome,Blue Mosque,Hagia Sophia, the Cistern, Topkapi Palace and a short walk to the main harbour for Tour Boats. Highly recommend it for a holiday base.

Reviews.Title: “Adamar Hotel very good hotel & good central location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: uptonuponsevern
Reviews.Content: On transfer from the Airport to the hotel we were both wondering what to expect when arriving at the hotel to our surprise it's a great location, only a 5 min's walk to all the main attractions within central Istanbul. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly, the rooms were modern basic & very clean, only negative if you like watching TV, it only had one English channel BBC World. The hotel staff were good in advising on good local tours, B/fast & evening meals were very good for value & a good choice with great fast service. Great views from the roof terrace, we would strongly recommend this hotel to our friends. Be aware of the Turkish drivers they drive very fast with confidence & don't forget to agree on a taxi fare before getting into the cab, we got ripped off twice with the fare. Coffee & tea facilities in the hotel room would have been appreciated. Check your hotel bill before paying at reception, our invoice was totally different to what we agreed on over the internet, staff corrected invoice after showing my confirmed rate by printing off the email when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: craftyketley
Reviews.Content: I cannot really add to all the rave reviews of the Adamar, only endorse. them. Wonderful staff, so friendly and helpful, comfortable, though small rooms and a panoramic view from the roof terrace and the restaurant that take your breath away. What a bonus also, to have free wireless access. The food in the restaurant is excellent and reasonably priced. We ate there twice but for a more cosy, intimate atmosphere, try the Istanbul restaurant in the road opposite (Alaykosku Street) My husband, daughter and myself were so glad we picked this hotel, it was a joy to come back to after a busy day`s sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Admiration for the Adamar”
Reviews.Author: Everyonerocks
Reviews.Content: Looked at several hotel reviews on Trip Advisor before deciding on the Adamar. What swung it was the hotel's roof top terrace with its panoramic view of this wonderful city. It is incredible - an Istanbul attraction in itself. If there hadn't been so much else to see and do we'd have been up there all the time looking at the wonderful buildings, watching the constant stream of shipping and cruise liners coming in to port. Everything else about the Adamar is fantastic too - the staff, the rooms, the free internet and its position - so much is within easy walking distance, as are the trams which can take you further afield. We couldn't have made a better choice and (because 4 nights wasn't nearly enough time) will definitely go back there again. PS: If you're up for it (!) being up on the terrace at sunrise is fab!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has everything!”
Reviews.Author: PaulPerthAu
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 18 days in Turkey and stayed at the Adamar twice during that time. Not only is the hotel perfectly located but it boasts the best views from both the restaurant and terrace. You feel as though you could reach out and touch Hagia Sophia. The staff at the hotel are exceptional. Nothing is too much trouble and their warm friendly manner makes you feel welcome. We will definitely stay there again and I would happily recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: Rogaldo
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is near the major cultural activities in Istanbul, then this is it. Haghia Sophia, the blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and the tram are all within a stone's throw of the hotel. The free internet access is a real plus and the staff are very friendly and helpful. As we stayed for 6 nights a free shuttle service to and from the airport was included, which again was another great plus. Go and see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent "Boutique" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: docdom
Reviews.Content: Shuttle from the airport is confortable (Mercedes van), welcome at reception is efficient and warm (many foreign languages spoken). The building is impressive, as they kept the best of this historical hotel from the 19th century but totally renovated the inside. The rooms are decorated in a style discretely reminding you that you are at the gate of the Orient. Total modern comfort is there as well (including a fair control of the outside noise, which is a challenge in this town) which means that this boutique hotel has for me, the perfect combination : History and Comfort. It has a soul. You will understand the History part better when you go to the veranda on the top of the building: you can embrace the best panoramic view I've ever seen int this town (I spent quite some time in Istanbul). It's all there, Saint Sophia, the Blue Mosque, The Topkapi Palace, the Bosphorous, The Prices' Islands. As far as you can see, you have the entire city at your feet. You cross continents in a glance, as well as centuries. You can almost touch the sky as well, you are truly in a privileged location to enjoy your stay . Once outside of the building, you are at walking distance of all these marvels and in immediate contact with the heart of Istanbul. Treat yourself: stay at this Adamar Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sazsaz3
Reviews.Content: Staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, nothing seemed too much trouble. Location is great very close to some of the main tourist sites. Good selection for breakfast and dinner in the resturant was a reasonible price for the quality, it was the best meal that we had. The roof top terrace was great for views. We booked a standard room but on arrival were upgraded to a suite which was fine in terms of size, it wasn't massive but we spent most of our spare time on the roof terrace enjoying the view. Our package included a free transfer from the airport and we booked with the hotel for the return trip, both of which were hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: mally777
Reviews.Content: Great location, in Sultanahmet, walking distance to main sights such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bazaars. Helpful friendly staff. Good rooms, clean and tidy. Nice Turkish buffet breakfast. Only downside was an extremely expensive mini-bar in rooms, with each can of coke the equivalent of over 2 pounds each, and a small chocolate bar at almost 3 pounds. Overall very good and recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul, amazing location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: paakhus
Reviews.Content: WIth a rooftop restaurant and marvelous staff, a block from Aghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, short walks to the Bosphorus, the Grand Bazaar and the Archeological Museum, I will definitely return to this hotel. Delicious kabob, super wine and unbeatable view from the rooftop and from my room: 501, which was very quiet. The staff was extremely helpful in every regard. A great hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our trip”
Reviews.Author: Cotterrell
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel (after days of searching on the net) for a family birthday celebration. It could scarcely have been better. The location is excellent for visiting all the major sights. The staff were always friendly and so courteous, they got the tone just right. We paid for a larger room which was well worth it - lots of light flooding in and we do like space. Our room and the whole hotel was spotless and there were fresh towels and bed linen daily. But best of all was the 6th floor restaurant and the 7th floor roof terrace - wonderful views, an excellent breakfast buffet and dinner. We wished afterwards we'd dined more often at the hotel, it was the best food we had in Istanbul and not expensive. No gripes then except I have a strong personal dislike of fixed coat-hangers, they just irritate me! And there wasn't much space for clothes in the wardrobe, no chest of drawers. Both only minor minus points. Overall an absolutely wonderful week at the Adamar.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to imagine a nicer hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CathyRhino
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Adamar Hotel for a family birthday. Absolutely lovely hotel - fantastic location with easy walks to everywhere in Sultanahmet, great public transport connections; immaculately clean rooms; very friendly staff who make a real effort to speak a number of languages; great breakfasts with lots of fresh fruit, yoghurt, cheese, cold meat, olives, breads and hot dishes; and best of all, the sixth floor restaurant and seventh floor roof terrace. We ate here the last night, great cooking and a real treat (but no more expensive than other places we went to). The height and location mean that you can see all the way round, from the Golden Horn to the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara, and everything in between. Having a drink at dusk and watching all the lights come on kept us as happy as anything for all five nights. And they had spotted from his passport that it was my father's birthday and gave him a card. Strongly, strongly recommended for anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “View to Die For!”
Reviews.Author: alasn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at end of may 2009 and enjoyed it immensely. The panoramic views from the restaurant and roof lounge are just perfectly giddy and truly unforgettable. The Adamar is a compact tall hotel in terms of ground-space - but bijou and rather boutique-like. Extremely helpful and friendly staff and high levels of cleanliness and well maintained everywhere. Try breakfast offers a view to die for, or take coffee or an evening Raki to the rooftop and you'll see what I mean - although the bedrooms face away from Sultanahmet Square - the sea and Golden Horn wrap round the Hotel area beautifully. Generous breakfast times facilitate a lie-in and each floor has a separate colour scheme and tasteful decor - even a phone in the bathroom - though who knows why. In terms of location,the Adamar is perfect - at the end of the street - the dreamy mosques,a few yards from the Cistern and 20 minutes stroll to the bazaars and Galata Bridge....you'll be able to stroll to all the main sites. The staff were so helpful, that when the airport shuttle was late, they phoned twice and even offered a car all the way to the budget airport on the Asian side of the Bosphorus as a contingency. They'll automatically return and collect you from Attaturk Airport anyway. Location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, highly recommended, go there!”
Reviews.Author: UKTurkeyTrotter
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the middle of the city, within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia, Main Cisterns & Topkapi. The trams stop near by and you can easily take an interesting walk to the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Boat Piers for Bosphorous trips (or take the tram from the stop near) the main Tourist Info place. Minimal intrusive external noise but hey, it's in the city centre! The Hotel met us at the Aiport and took us to the Hotel which was very welcome. We made our own return journey arrangements but I'm sure the Hotel would have been more than willing to help if we had asked. The rooms are on the small side but quite adequate (you wont lose each other) and easy to move around in. Spotlessly clean, good bathroom fresh linen, all you could ask for. There is a roof top Resaurant serving delcious Turkish and other main stream food and a good selection of wine (Kavalidere, Doluga and imports), beer & spirits at very reasonable prices. Stunning panoramic views from Suliman's Mosque right round the Goldn Horn to the Blue Mosque including the Borphorus Bridge. Wonderful at dusk and into the night. It was so good, we ate there twice in a 5 day stay. Lots of other recommended Restaurants nearby. The staff are fluently multi-lingual, very helpful and friendly (without being familiar). We forgot a small package and they sent it home without a quibble. The Internet works well and the Hotel is accommodating as to how you use it (own/hotel computer). The Hotel has an interesting and very smooth, reliable, partially glazed, part hydraulic/part rope, lift which worked all the time (not everyone can say that!). In short: Great Hotel, highly recommended, go there.

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: comaje
Reviews.Content: Ottawa, May 26, 2009 We stayed at the Adamar Hotel for 6 days. It's a new place, spotless, nice pastel colors in the rooms, and efficient staff. You have a good breakfast in the restaurant on the 6th floor, and you can take your coffee up the stairs to the 7th floor rooftop terrace. The view from the terrace is unbelievable, simply out of this world: To your left you have the Bosphorus with all those ferries going back and forth, and to your right you have the Marmara Sea. After sunset, Saint Sophia( in front of you) and the Blue Mosque(a bit to your right) light up. Unreal. The hotel is as central as you can have. We walked all day every where. There are 5 rooms on each floor. One reservation: DO NOT TAKE rooms 101, 201, 301, 401, 501, unless you are alone, as they are very small. For two people, the best rooms are 102, 202, 302, 402, 502. The 103...104... are also good size rooms and the 105... are family rooms. On the 5th floor you may have some noise from the restaurant. above. In we were to go back, we would not hesitate to pick the Adamar again or to recommend it to friends. We have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBackpack
Reviews.Content: Been there for 4 nights in last April. I asked for the free pick-up service and they were there at the Airport waiting for me at the scheduled time, just as they promised. Check-in was fast, no hassles. The room is good, perhaps a little small if you're not alone. Safe box in the room. Amazing location, just 2 blocks from Ayasofia and Blue Mosque, even closer to Basilic Cistern. Staff very helpful and polite. Nice breakfast with a great view! Definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, BUT”
Reviews.Author: jkiter09
Reviews.Content: It's rate 4* but it's better a a 3*, practically only a tiny bar with a small reception 4x4 m2, 1 elevator and 5 floor rooms.
